channel.title: Pages on open collector
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on open collector

item.title: About
item.description: open collector is just one person, Dave. I’m a hobbyist hacking on MCUs, sensors, physical fabrication techniques, circuits, and on occasion, radio stuff. I have experience and work with Linux/Unix related stuff, so you may see a bit of crossover into that from time to time.

item.title: Avrrrinator B
item.description: Silkscreen text (bottom): “Squirrel Packing A Ruby Laser Rod” For the prior revision A release (single output, no logic level voltage translation), click here. This is revision B, adding two outputs behind buffers (which also offers logic level voltage shifting). With revision B, you can flash two attached projects (not at the same time!) without moving your cables around. This could be mis-construed to be more awesome than it is, so just to be clear: This isn’t a jig for mass-manufacturing, but for projects where it is nice to compare and contrast among two devices.

item.title: Avrrrinator Rev. A
item.description: Documentation for the latest Avrrrinator Rev. A board is located here.
